intro: Argentina papuana, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude regions, thriving in cool and moist environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often hairy as well. Argentina papuana is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in temperate climates.
